Class Planet

java.lang.Object
  Planet

public class Planet
extends Object

The representation of a planet, defined by its mass, radius, velocity, and Ellipse

Version:
4/24/15
Author:
Rob Norton
See Also:
SolarSystem, Vector2D

Constructor Summary
Planet(int screenHeight, int screenWidth)
          Constructor for planet, creates a random starting x and y position and a random velocity based on the x and y distance from the sun
 
Method Summary
 Vector2D getCenter()
          Returns the center of the planet
 Ellipse2D.Double getCircle()
          Returns the Ellipse2D of the planet
 double getMass()
          Returns the mass of the planet
 int getRadius()
          Calculates the radius based on the mass
 Vector2D getVelocity()
          Returns the Vector2D representation of the velocity of the planet
 void resize()
          Creates a new ellipse to represent the increased radius size
 void setCenter(Vector2D center)
          Sets the center of the planet
 void setMass(double newmass)
          Sets the mass of the planet
 void setVelocity(Vector2D newVelocity)
          Sets the velocity of the planet
 
Methods inherited from class
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
